mechanics.condition: Creature or object is within a 50-foot radius, 100-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range AND is NOT anchored to the ground
mechanics.outcome: Creature or object falls upward and reaches the top of the area

mechanics.trigger: Creature within spell area when cast
mechanics.condition: Creature is subjected to upward fall AND can reach a fixed object AND succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Creature grabs onto the object and avoids falling upward

mechanics.condition: Falling creature or object encounters a solid object (e.g., ceiling) during upward fall
mechanics.outcome: Creature or object strikes the solid object, as per a normal downward fall (potential bludgeoning damage)

mechanics.condition: Creature or object reaches the top of the area without striking anything
mechanics.outcome: Creature or object remains at the top of the area for the spell's duration

mechanics.condition: Creature or object was affected by Reverse Gravity
mechanics.outcome: Affected creature or object falls back down

description_text: This spell reverses gravity in a 50-foot-radius, 100-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area fall upward and reach the top of the area when you cast this spell. A creature can make a dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, thus avoiding the fall. If some solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it just as they would during a normal downward fall. If an object or creature reaches the top of the area without striking anything, it remains there, oscillating slightly, for the duration. At the end of the duration, affected objects and creatures fall back down.
